eu.davidea.viewholders

Class ExpandableViewHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
      • eu.davidea.viewholders.ContentViewHolder
        • eu.davidea.viewholders.FlexibleViewHolder
          • eu.davidea.viewholders.ExpandableViewHolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnLongClickListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener, ItemTouchHelperCallback.ViewHolderCallback

    public abstract class ExpandableViewHolder
extends FlexibleViewHolder
    ViewHolder for a Expandable Items. It holds methods which can be used to trigger expansion or collapsing events.

    This class extends FlexibleViewHolder, which means it will benefit of all implemented methods the super class holds.

    Since:
    16/01/2016 Created

        Since:

      • ExpandableViewHolder

        public ExpandableViewHolder(android.view.View view,
                            FlexibleAdapter adapter,
                            boolean stickyHeader)
        Constructor to configure the sticky behaviour of a view.

        Note: StickyHeader works only if the item has been declared of type IHeader.

        Parameters:
        view - The View being hosted in this ViewHolder
        adapter - Adapter instance of type FlexibleAdapter
        stickyHeader - true if the View can be a Sticky Header, false otherwise
        Since:
        5.0.0-b7

    • Method Detail

      • isViewExpandableOnClick

        protected boolean isViewExpandableOnClick()
        Allows to expand or collapse child views of this itemView when View.OnClickListener event occurs on the entire view.

        This method returns always true; Extend with "return false" to Not expand or collapse this ItemView onClick events.

        Returns:
        always true, if not overridden
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • isViewCollapsibleOnClick

        protected boolean isViewCollapsibleOnClick()
        Allows to collapse child views of this ItemView when View.OnClickListener event occurs on the entire view.

        This method returns always true; Extend with "return false" to Not collapse this ItemView onClick events.

        Returns:
        always true, if not overridden
        Since:
        5.0.4

      • isViewCollapsibleOnLongClick

        protected boolean isViewCollapsibleOnLongClick()
        Allows to collapse child views of this ItemView when View.OnLongClickListener event occurs on the entire view.

        This method returns always true; Extend with "return false" to Not collapse this ItemView onLongClick events.

        Returns:
        always true, if not overridden
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1

      • shouldNotifyParentOnClick

        protected boolean shouldNotifyParentOnClick()
        Allows to notify change and rebound this itemView on expanding and collapsing events, in order to update the content (so, user can decide to display the current expanding status).

        This method returns always false; Override with "return true" to trigger the notification.

        Returns:
        true to rebound the content of this itemView on expanding and collapsing events, false to ignore the events
        Since:
        5.0.0-rc1
        See Also:
        expandView(int), collapseView(int)

      • toggleExpansion

        protected void toggleExpansion()
        Expands or Collapses based on the current state AND on the configuration of the methods isViewExpandableOnClick() and isViewCollapsibleOnClick().
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        shouldNotifyParentOnClick(), isViewExpandableOnClick(), isViewCollapsibleOnClick(), expandView(int), collapseView(int)

      • expandView

        protected void expandView(int position)
        Triggers expansion of this itemView.

        If shouldNotifyParentOnClick() returns true, this view is rebound with payload Payload.EXPANDED.

        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        shouldNotifyParentOnClick()

      • collapseView

        protected void collapseView(int position)
        Triggers collapse of this itemView.

        If shouldNotifyParentOnClick() returns true, this view is rebound with payload Payload.COLLAPSED.

        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        shouldNotifyParentOnClick()

      • onClick

        @CallSuper
public void onClick(android.view.View view)
        Called when user taps once on the ItemView.

        Note: In Expandable version, it tries to expand, but before, it checks if the view isViewExpandableOnClick().

        Specified by:
        onClick in interface android.view.View.OnClickListener
        Overrides:
        onClick in class FlexibleViewHolder
        Parameters:
        view - the view that receives the event
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        FlexibleViewHolder.toggleActivation()

      • onLongClick

        @CallSuper
public boolean onLongClick(android.view.View view)
        Called when user long taps on this itemView.

        Note: In Expandable version, it tries to collapse, but before, it checks if the view isViewCollapsibleOnLongClick().

        Specified by:
        onLongClick in interface android.view.View.OnLongClickListener
        Overrides:
        onLongClick in class FlexibleViewHolder
        Parameters:
        view - the view that receives the event
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        FlexibleViewHolder.toggleActivation()

      • onActionStateChanged

        @CallSuper
public void onActionStateChanged(int position,
                                             int actionState)
        Here we handle the event of when the ItemTouchHelper first registers an item as being moved or swiped.

        In this implementation, View activation is automatically handled if dragged: The Item will be added to the selection list if not selected yet and mode MULTI is activated.

        Note: In the Expandable version, expanded items are forced to collapse.

        Specified by:
        onActionStateChanged in interface ItemTouchHelperCallback.ViewHolderCallback
        Overrides:
        onActionStateChanged in class FlexibleViewHolder
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the item touched
        actionState - one of ItemTouchHelper.ACTION_STATE_SWIPE or ItemTouchHelper.ACTION_STATE_DRAG.
        Since:
        5.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        FlexibleViewHolder.shouldActivateViewWhileSwiping(), FlexibleViewHolder.shouldAddSelectionInActionMode()
